block.p: Michael J. Halloran, the senior partner of the corporate and securities practice group at Pillsbury Winthrop Shaw Pittman, has been named deputy chief of staff and counselor to Christopher Cox, the chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission.

Bank of America has named Joseph P. Blauvelt a managing director and head of the central funding group. Three others will join the group and report to Mr. Blauvelt: Forbes Hopper, a managing director; Xavier Negroni, a managing director; and Anthony Kowalski, a principal. All four join from J.P. Morgan Chase.

Three others will join the group and report to Mr. Blauvelt: Forbes Hopper, a managing director; Xavier Negroni, a managing director; and Anthony Kowalski, a principal. All four join from J.P. Morgan Chase.
People Paul M. Simons, formerly of Merrill Lynch, is joining Credit Suisse as a managing director and head of client relationship management and development for private banking for the Americas.
Deutsche Bank has named Michael Burke as a managing director and head of United States private client services. Mr. Burke was with Morgan Stanley.

Zarrar Sehgal and Anthony A. Lopez III have joined Clifford Chance as partners in the New York office. Mr. Sehgal, formerly of Milbank, Tweed, Hadley & McCloy, will be co-head, with John Howitt, of Clifford Chance's New York asset finance group. Mr. Lopez, formerly of Cahill Gordon & Reindel, is joining the firm's corporate finance practice.
Mark R. Winston has joined Aon Consulting as a managing director. Mr. Winston joins from Baker & McKenzie, where he was a partner.
Eric Schatz has joined Barclays Capital as a director in foreign-exchange sales for the Americas. He was previously with Citibank.
David W. Dorman, a former chief executive and chairman of AT&T, will join the private equity firm of Warburg Pincus as a senior adviser.

Seyfarth Shaw has named two new partners. Kevin P. McGrath, formerly with Goodwin Procter, has joined the firm's securities and financial litigation practice in the Boston office. Charles C. Pak, formerly of Kirkland & Ellis, has joined the corporate and finance practice in the Los Angeles office.
